kelvin90701

Chapter 1: Buy a cell phone. Stop or you'll force me to dial 911.
 
 Chapter 2: Unarmed self-defense. Stop or you'll force me to say "Stop" again.
 
 Chapter 3: No gun? Hire a body guard, with a gun.
 
 Chapter 4: Aviod danger. Stay at home. When felons break into your home, study chapter 1-3.
 
 Please feel free to add more chapters.

post_info.post_title: Help me write a new book: Self-defense for Dummies

kelvin90701

Guncontrol assumes that the personal safety an individual will give up, a greater degree of saftey is achived for the whole community. Thus when I am in trouble the community will be there to help me.
 
 http://stacks.msnbc.com/news/873184.asp?cp1=1
 
 This killling was done with a firearm. But it could have been just as well with a bat, a knife, or a crowbar. The result will be the same, the people that guncontrol assumes will be there to help, don't care. You may argue that if there were no guns Allen Price would be alive today. I argue if Allen Price were killed with a baseball bat, then the people at the gas station would have done the same thing, walk away.
 
 You have only yourself to depend on, not the cops, not your neighbors, and not the community.
JFriday

You should call the Brady Center for help, 
 and dont forget: do the SNiVel.
Brady
Self defense for dummies: buy a gun because your more likely to shoot a family member than a criminal and if you have a high capacity magazine you can shoot even more family members.
Pietro

Brady you really aren't trying to make a serious argument. For starters you resurrected a thread that's eight years old. That's hardly the move of someone who's interested in the facts. And then there's your post itself.
 
 
Self defense for dummies: buy a gun because your more likely to shoot a family member than a criminal and if you have a high capacity magazine you can shoot even more family members.

 
 You cite no information of any sort to back up your claim. Rather you just throw it out there as if you didn't bother to think of it. Your idea of self defense is to not take responsibility for yourself and instead let somebody else come to your aid. That's hardly sound advice to be offering. You might as well be advising people to not brush their teeth because they have dentists to provide proper oral hygiene.
Brady

You cite no information of any sort to back up your claim. 

 I just assumed you were knowledgable about basic facts. I must be wrong.
 
 Gun death rates are 7 times higher in the states with the highest compared with the lowest household gun ownership. (Harvard School of Public Health, Harvard Injury Control Research Center, 2009).
 
 States with the highest levels of gun ownership have 114 percent higher firearm homicide rates and 60 percent higher homicide rates than states with the lowest gun ownership (Miller, Hemenway, and Azrael, 2007, pp. 659, 660).
 
 Every time a gun injures or kills in self-defense, it is used:
 * 11 times for completed and attempted suicides (Kellermann, 1998, 
 p.263).
 * 7 times in criminal assaults and homicides, and
 * 4 times in unintentional shooting deaths or injuries.
 Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence : Guns in the Home
Doc Jones

I just assumed you were knowledgable about basic facts. I must be wrong.
 
 Gun death rates are 7 times higher in the states with the highest compared with the lowest household gun ownership. (Harvard School of Public Health, Harvard Injury Control Research Center, 2009).
 
 States with the highest levels of gun ownership have 114 percent higher firearm homicide rates and 60 percent higher homicide rates than states with the lowest gun ownership (Miller, Hemenway, and Azrael, 2007, pp. 659, 660).
 
 Every time a gun injures or kills in self-defense, it is used:
 * 11 times for completed and attempted suicides (Kellermann, 1998, 
 p.263).
 * 7 times in criminal assaults and homicides, and
 * 4 times in unintentional shooting deaths or injuries.
 Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence : Guns in the Home

 
 Even if that were true, which it isn't, exactly what does that have to do with a individual, FUNDAMENTAL RIGHT and the free exercise thereof? You have lost any revelance at all. None of your claims are true.
Pietro

I just assumed you were knowledgable about basic facts. I must be wrong.
 
 Gun death rates are 7 times higher in the states with the highest compared with the lowest household gun ownership. (Harvard School of Public Health, Harvard Injury Control Research Center, 2009).
 
 States with the highest levels of gun ownership have 114 percent higher firearm homicide rates and 60 percent higher homicide rates than states with the lowest gun ownership (Miller, Hemenway, and Azrael, 2007, pp. 659, 660).
 
 Every time a gun injures or kills in self-defense, it is used:
 * 11 times for completed and attempted suicides (Kellermann, 1998, 
 p.263).
 * 7 times in criminal assaults and homicides, and
 * 4 times in unintentional shooting deaths or injuries.
 Brady Campaign to Prevent Gun Violence : Guns in the Home

 
 Normally I'd go into detail tearing apart these false statistics, pointing out that without a breakdown on the type of deaths recorded the figures could easily be padded to include felonious killings related to gang activity.
 
 But since you cited the Brady Campaign I see no need to waste my time, proving them wrong as they do that themselves.
Penfold

Open carry is a great idea. You know you are safer when you are near one, but not too close. Then you can relax, safe in the knowledge that if anything happens, they are 4.5 times more likely to draw fire than you are.
Pietro

Open carry is a great idea. You know you are safer when you are near one, but not too close. Then you can relax, safe in the knowledge that if anything happens, they are 4.5 times more likely to draw fire than you are.

 
 For what reason should anyone be concerned about someone exercising their constitutional rights? Surely you're not advocating fear of a legal activity. You're not about to propose we adopt the British way of doing things where everyone is scared to death and can't trust their own neighbors. That's a world where even the police aren't trusted because they might go bad at the drop of a hat and kill people should they ever be armed.
